treatment.description: Roots 15 or fewer, yellow to brown, 0.5--2 mm diam. 1cm from base. Plants over 12 cm. Common stalk lacking idioblasts (elongate, spindle-shaped cells in vascular strand). Trophophore sessile and erect, arising from middle to distal portion of common stalk well above ground level; blade usually 1 per plant, seasonal, absent during winter, deltate, 3--4-pinnate, 5--25 cm wide when mature, thin, herbaceous. Leaf primordia densely hairy, hairs 1.5--2mm. Leaf sheath open. Pinna divisions reduced in size to tip. First pinnule on basal pinnae usually borne acroscopically. Sporophores long-stalked, arising from middle to distal portion of common stalk well above ground level, commonly absent due to abortion in early development or seasonal, stalks only slightly flattened, not fleshy, 0.5--0.8mm wide. x =92.
